intro: Chrysocephalum asperum, commonly known as the rough blue everlasting, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its dense clusters of small, bright yellow to golden-orange flowers. The plant has narrow, slightly hairy leaves and is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes used in floral arrangements. Chrysocephalum asperum is also known for its ability to thrive in poor soil conditions and its tolerance to drought.
